fdd:identificationAndDescription.fdd:fullName: Matroska File Format with LPCM Audio Encoding
fdd:identificationAndDescription.fdd:description: Matroska file containing an audio essence encoded as Linear Pulse Code Modulated (LPCM).
fdd:identificationAndDescription.fdd:shortDescription: Matroska file containing an audio essence encoded as Linear Pulse Code Modulated (LPCM)
fdd:identificationAndDescription.fdd:productionPhase: Middle state, used for storage or archiving

fdd:relationship.fdd:comment: Video essences and other elements in various encodings.

fdd:sustainabilityFactors.fdd:disclosure: Both Mastroska and LPCM are open standards. Matroska is an offshoot of the Multimedia Container Format project.
fdd:sustainabilityFactors.fdd:documentation: The Matroska specification is published online at http://www.matroska.org/technical/specs/index.html. The history of PCM is varied and extends back to at least the 1930s. For a discussion of its history and documentation see LPCM.
fdd:sustainabilityFactors.fdd:adoption: Modest adoption of the combination of Matroska and LPCM. One example can be found on the website of the Canadian Archivematica project; LPCM is the preservation format for audio and Matroska the preservation file format for video files.
